answerText: CretaceousPaleogene or CretaceousTertiary or KPg or KT extinction (prompt on "extinction of the dinosaurs" or "meteor that caused the extinction" or descriptive answers that don't mention the periods)[10] This other event was a contender for the cause of the KT extinction, but it's been less popular since the Alvarez hypothesis came into vogue. Lava from this event left behind massive basalt beds more than a mile thick in the region it's named for.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Editors 4 | 8 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this event 65 million years ago in which most animal and plant species on earth, including the dinosaurs, abruptly died.
